items.title: Banks getting it right, net interest margins on the mend
items.summary: Eight of the 24 banks reporting Q2 earnings have seen sequential improvements in net interest margins (NIMs), signaling a potential bottoming out of this key profitability metric. Indian Overseas Bank led the pack, with its NIM rising 21 basis points to 3.21% following a business re-engineering initiative that increased MCLR-linked loans. Federal Bank also reported strong growth, with NIM up 12 basis points to 3.06%.

items.summary: India's popular gin and tonic trend is fading. Vodka and tequila are now leading the market. Gin sales have dropped significantly this year. This shift affects both established brands and newer craft gins. Consumers are exploring different spirits. The gin market faces challenges with brand loyalty and competition. Major companies are entering the gin space through acquisitions and new launches.

items.title: India set to lead in Asia-Pacific office supply next year

Bengaluru is expected to add 13.09 million sq ft, Hyderabad 9.25 million sq ft, and Delhi-NCR 8.98 million sq ft, surpassing major Asian cities like Shanghai, Shenzhen, and Beijing. Mumbai will add over 4.3 million sq ft.

items.title: India plans single-window system to ease approvals for live events
items.summary: India is launching a new digital portal to simplify permissions for live shows and cultural festivals, aiming for approvals within 15 days. This move by the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, developed by the Live Events Development Cell, seeks to boost the rapidly growing ₹20,800 crore live entertainment market and create millions of jobs.

items.title: India's counter-tariff strategy begins to show results
items.summary: Indian exports face challenges from US tariffs. However, India is successfully diversifying its export markets. This strategy is showing positive results, with growth in many countries. While some sectors are impacted, overall export performance remains resilient. India is turning trade barriers into opportunities for long-term gain.

items.title: Delhi to revive homestay scheme, letting residents host tourists
items.summary: Delhi is set to revive its Bed and Breakfast scheme. The tourism department is looking at Goa's successful model. This aims to simplify registration and verification. Residents can rent out rooms to tourists. The initiative seeks to provide affordable accommodation. It also helps homeowners earn income. Plans include improving service quality and cleanliness.

items.title: Zee to broadcast Baseball United’s inaugural season in India
items.summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises has partnered with Baseball United to broadcast the league's inaugural season live in India. The deal brings 21 games, featuring India's first professional baseball franchise, the Mumbai Cobras, to Indian audiences this November and December. Matches will stream on Zee5 and air on Zee Café SD, &Flix SD, and &Pictures HD in English and Hindi.

items.title: India's luxury watch market set to grow 11-12% annually as affluence rises: Report
items.summary: India's luxury watch market is projected for robust annual growth of 11-12%, fueled by an expanding affluent population and rising wealth among HNIs. Consumers are increasingly trading up to premium timepieces, with the share of luxury watch sales jumping significantly.

items.title: DU’s Open Learning students hit by soaring fees, scarce classes, and missing study materials
items.summary: Delhi University's School of Open Learning has seen its fees more than double in five years. Students report delayed study materials and irregular classes. Access to campus facilities is also limited. The administration defends the fee hikes, citing university policy and financial aid. Students remain concerned about the value of their education.

items.title: Stock markets surge in early trade; Sensex jumps over 700 points
items.summary: A sharp rally in global markets also added to the markets’ optimism during the initial trade

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 20 October 2025: Sensex, Nifty settle higher; buying in Reliance Industries stock, foreign fund inflows lift markets
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty, Share Price: Equity benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty ended higher on Monday, taking their winning run to the fourth day in a row, driven by buying in blue-chip Reliance Industries and sustained foreign fund inflows.

A sharp rally in global markets also added to the markets' optimism.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 411.18 points or 0.49 per cent to settle at 84,363.37. During the day, it zoomed 704.37 points or 0.83 per cent to 84,656.56.

The 50-share NSE Nifty surged 133.30 points or 0.52 per cent to 25,843.15.

From the Sensex firms, Reliance Industries climbed 3.52 per ce

items.title: Swiss luxury watch brands getting ready for a great time in India, says Rado CEO
items.summary: For Swiss watchmakers, India’s trade liberalisation comes as a welcome counterbalance to global headwinds. As customs barriers ease, companies like Rado expect to capture a larger share of India’s luxury spending, powered by an expanding middle class and a youthful workforce with growing disposable income.

items.title: Why is Sam Altman’s ChatGPT flirting with erotica? The answer reveals an uncomfortable truth about AI today
items.summary: As OpenAI works on monetizing ChatGPT, its boss Sam Altman has shifted from the lofty rhetoric of AI advancing the greater good of humanity to the grubby reality of chasing market demand. ChatGPT’s turn to erotica exemplifies this.

items.title: Russian oil a roadblock? India likely edges closer to trade deal with US amid tariff talks
items.summary: India and the US are reportedly making positive progress on long-standing trade issues, narrowing differences on tariffs and market access. Discussions are moving towards a potential agreement, despite ongoing tensions over India's imports of Russian crude oil, which is a key sticking point.

items.title: Trump's India squeeze may push Russian oil further into the shadows
items.summary: Donald Trump is pressuring India to limit its intake of Russian oil in an effort to squeeze Moscow's revenue. However, this could lead to an expanded underground market for the resource.

items.title: Rupee spurts 14 paise to 87.88 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: The rupee hit a low of 87.95 and a high of 87.88 in the early session

items.title: Tycoon Geminder Is Said to Weigh Sale of Asia Businesses
items.summary: Australian tycoon Raphael Geminder is considering selling the Asian operations of his packaging companies, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

items.title: Nvidia is ‘100% out of China’ — Jensen Huang warns what harms Beijing can often harm US ‘even in worse ways’
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang cautioned against strict regulations on China's access to US technology, asserting they may damage the US economy. He emphasised the importance of maintaining connections with China's AI ecosystem, as half of the world's AI researchers are in China.&nbsp;

items.title: Korean business leaders meet Trump amid tariff talks
items.summary: South Korea's top conglomerate leaders joined U.S. President Donald Trump for a round of golf in Florida, in what observers view as an effort to strengthen economic and diplomatic ties between the two countries, as reported by the Pulse, the English service of Maeil Business Newspaper Korea.

items.title: NFR to install acoustic-based tech across its railway network to protect elephants
items.summary: Northeast Frontier Railway is rolling out advanced acoustic technology to save elephants. This system detects elephant movement near tracks, alerting train drivers. Trials are successful in key sections. The project aims for full functionality by April 2026. This initiative protects wildlife and ensures safe train operations across elephant corridors.

items.title: Does it matter if India’s trends of nominal and real GDP growth diverge?
items.summary: India’s high real GDP growth numbers reflect extraordinarily low inflation readings. Nominal GDP, which has weakened, offers a better view of the economy for practical purposes. Expect RBI to lower borrowing costs.

items.title: Global banks bet billions on India deals amid US credit jitters
items.summary: Indian banks are attracting significant foreign investment, with billions of dollars flowing into the sector. Deals worth approximately $15 billion have been struck this year. Global investors are seeking opportunities in India's rapidly growing economy. This trend highlights the country's stable financial system and robust regulators. Policymakers are also exploring ways to further encourage foreign investment.

items.title: JioStar, Collective Media Network launch AI-powered ‘Mahabharat: Ek Dharmayudh’
items.summary: JioStar and Collective Media Network are launching 'Mahabharat: Ek Dharmayudh,' India's first AI-powered premium entertainment series. This 100-episode show, streaming on JioHotstar from October 25 and airing on Star Plus from October 26, reimagines the epic with advanced AI for an immersive visual experience, blending tradition and technology.

items.title: Handelsbanken Investors Demand More Transparency From Swedish Bank
items.summary: Some shareholders in Handelsbanken say they are concerned about its conservatism and lack of transparency.

items.title: This Deepavali, let’s celebrate the power of reforms to help India fulfil its dreams
items.summary: If GST 1.0 was a ‘One Nation, One Tax’ revolution that eased internal barriers, GST 2.0 injects the economy with a booster shot. This is the latest in a series of Modi era reforms that combine policy prudence with the public pulse to brighten India’s economic prospects.

items.title: Chinese economy slows to one-year low of 4.8% in Q3 amid property slump and US trade tensions
items.summary: China's economic growth slowed to 4.8% in Q3, the weakest in a year, due to a property slump and trade tensions. Policymakers are considering stimulus measures, though analysts are uncertain about further action this year amid risks from US tariffs and a need for economic rebalancing.

items.title: It’s festive season and Indians are spending more again. But will that last?
items.summary: From vehicle sales, FMCG goods, to UPI transactions, India's consumption indicates a pick-up. But this coincides with the year's main festival season, when spending is high anyway. Mint explores what the latest data show and what it means for the economy.

items.title: As risks and returns shift across investment avenues, not investing may be the biggest risk of all
items.summary: Equity or debt? Real estate or gold? Bitcoin or art? With risks and returns in flux across the entire spectrum of investment avenues, it takes more bravery than usual for loss-averse retail investors to invest. What’s clear is that household funds mustn’t go idle.

items.title: Global Banks Bet Billions on India Deals Amid US Credit Jitters
items.summary: A spate of billion-dollar deals for Indian banks has thrust the country’s financial sector into the global spotlight, at a time when US credit losses and trade tensions have rattled investors globally.

items.title: Festive tax stimulus: Will a sales bounce mop up enough GST to plug revenue gaps?
items.summary: India’s GST rate cuts have begun to show their sparkle at the retail level. How well this bold fiscal bet works out depends on expanded sales volumes filling tax coffers with money to offset revenue losses. Is this likely?

items.summary: Why Deendayal Port Authority is scaling down its shipbuilding ambition

items.summary: Bank holiday today: Banks in severel parts of the country are scheduled to be closed on Monday, 20 October for Diwali, according to RBI holiday calendar.

items.title: 'Cut Russian oil or continue facing massive tariffs': Trump issues warning to India
items.summary: President Trump issued an ultimatum to India, threatening massive tariffs unless it significantly reduces its import of Russian crude oil. This move directly links Washington's goal of cutting Moscow's war funding to economic consequences for Indian exporters, following previous tariff hikes.

items.summary: Bankers say the move indicates a shift in policy that could lead to a wave of mergers and acquisitions in the financial services sector.

items.title: Uber pays idle drivers to train its AI
items.summary: Uber has about 1.4 million driver-partners in India and is monetising their idle time. Platforms with physical touchpoints—fleets, IoT devices, connected vehicles—benefit from such idle time to generate precious labelled data that can be used to train internal AI models or sold to third parties.

items.title: India’s equity capital market volumes to see heightened activity next year, Citi Group says
items.summary: India's equity capital market volumes are anticipated to exceed the current level of $46 billion next year, according to top Citi Group executives.

items.title: India’s top IT firms face FY26 test amid slow growth, AI deflation and visa pain
items.summary: The big five IT companies had their weakest year in recent memory in FY25, with two reporting revenue declines and overall growth not exceeding 4.5%. Much of this was because of fewer mega deals, low demand for IT work, and geopolitical tensions prompting clients to go slow on IT spending.

items.title: UK Pension Providers Team Up in Push for Infra, AI Investments
items.summary: Some of the UK’s largest pension providers and insurers have formed a group seeking to channel more money into the nation’s infrastructure and fast-growing businesses in sectors including artificial intelligence and fintech.

items.title: EV makers strike key policy victory as UP pulls plug on hybrid car incentives
items.summary: This means that prices of popular hybrid cars including Honda City, Toyota Innova Hycross and Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara could go up by as much as 10% in Uttar Pradesh, one of the largest markets for hybrid cars after Maharashtra and Karnataka.

items.title: Base-effect saves RIL Q2; a dilemma is now coming to the fore
items.summary: Reliance Industries' Q2 FY26 consolidated performance was heavily aided by a low base in O2C, retail and Jio Platforms.

items.title: Deepavali’s soul lost in glitter and cracker roar
items.summary: There’s something unique this time about the festival. After 1979, this is the first time when both gold and silver are beyond the common person’s reach.

items.title: Dial 1 for Disruption—BSNL's 1-rupee comeback plan rattles rivals
items.summary: The dispute surrounding BSNL's new  ₹1 plan revives memories of Reliance Jio’s 2016 entry, when free offers upended the market and triggered years of tariff wars.

items.title: DoT signals 5% AGR as satcom spectrum fee
items.summary: The Department of Telecommunications is leaning towards a 5% usage fee for satellite spectrum. This is higher than the 4% proposed by the industry regulator. This move could impact major satellite companies. The DoT will send its view back to the regulator for further suggestions. Spectrum allocation awaits final pricing decisions.

items.title: Festive sales season ends with a bang: Car, smartphone, and white goods purchases soar 50% compared to last year
items.summary: Festive shopping is booming. Companies selling everything from clothes to cars are seeing sales jump by up to 50 percent this year compared to last. This surge is driven by tax cuts and attractive discounts. Maruti Suzuki alone delivered 325,000 vehicles in a recent period, a 50 percent increase. The company also received 450,000 bookings.

items.title: Festive sales season ends with a bang: Car, smartphone, and white goods purchases soar 50% compared to last year
items.summary: Festive shopping is booming. Companies selling everything from clothes to cars are seeing sales jump by up to 50 per cent this year compared to last. This surge is driven by tax cuts and attractive discounts. Maruti alone delivered 325,000 vehicles in a recent period, a 50 per cent increase. The company also received 450,000 bookings.

items.summary: If executed well, Bima Sugam could do for insurance what UPI did for digital payments and ONDC aims to do for e-commerce

items.title: Paper gains are ‘naughty’
items.summary: Understanding the difference between profit and notiprofit in investing to avoid overreacting to paper gains

items.title: Broadcasters, distribution platform operators divided over new audit rules
items.summary: TRAI's potential alterations to broadcast auditing practices have led to a renewed clash in the media landscape, pitting broadcasters against distribution platform operators. DPOs express concerns over the presence of broadcaster reps during audits, as they fear it may compromise sensitive information. Meanwhile, broadcasters maintain that these tweaks could hinder their ability to validate subscriber counts effectively.

items.title: Attractiveness of Small Savings interest rates
items.summary: Rates are higher than required according to the formula; over the past four to five months, G-Sec yields inched up as the market is looking at end of the current RBI rate cut cycle

items.title: UltraTech Cement's fixed costs to drop in current quarter: CFO Atul Daga
items.summary: This quarter, UltraTech Cement plans to significantly lower its fixed costs by nearly ₹100 per tonne, driven by reduced maintenance, marketing efforts, and workforce expenses. As part of their growth strategy, the company is on track to enhance production capacity, surpassing the 200 million-tonne mark.

items.title: Move over FMCG, auto to take advertising crown
items.summary: Cars and bikes are leading advertising this festive season. The automobile sector is expected to overtake FMCG in ad spending for the first time. This shift is driven by GST-led discounts, strong festive demand, and a surge in new vehicle launches. FMCG companies are still adjusting to GST changes. This trend is anticipated to continue into the next quarter.

items.title: JSW Steel sees stronger consumption in H2 on lower rates, pent-up demand
items.summary: JSW Steel is anticipating a robust increase in steel demand, fueled by heightened consumption rates, decreasing interest rates, and ambitious government infrastructure initiatives. With automotive steel sales hitting record levels, the company is set to enhance its production capabilities. The uptick in private sector investments further reinforces the optimistic projection for the steel industry.

items.title: Same-sex couples again question uneven tax law
items.summary: Challenging the status quo, same-sex couples in India are stepping into the legal arena to contest income tax laws that unfairly tax gifts between partners. This particular law disproportionately favours heterosexual couples in stable, long-term partnerships. Two couples have taken their fight to the Bombay and Karnataka High Courts, demanding equal rights under the law.

items.title: Highway construction slows down; projected to hit 6-year low in FY26
items.summary: The momentum of national highway construction in India is expected to fade, with estimates predicting a fall to under 10,000 km in the upcoming fiscal year 2026. This decline is largely due to fewer project awards seen in the recent two years. Changing policies and a commitment to wrap up current projects are shaping the slowdown.

items.title: Brookfield makes ₹5,000 crore bid for India logistics push
items.summary: Brookfield is making a strategic leap into the Indian logistics market by acquiring a substantial portfolio that spans 13 mn square feet, sourced from a partnership between ESR and Allianz, alongside additional standout ESR assets. This strategic acquisition signals Brookfield's commitment to tapping into India's growing logistics and warehousing market, reflecting a robust institutional interest in the industry.

items.title: Finance ministry directs PSBs to tackle staff stress, set up corrective measures
items.summary: Government is urging public sector banks to tackle employee stress. This follows concerns over work pressure, targets, and staff shortages. Banks must now identify issues and create clear action plans. These efforts will be part of the EASE 8.0 reforms agenda. The focus is on building a resilient and engaged workforce. Banks are launching well-being initiatives and health index surveys.

items.title: India, Brazil initiate talks to expand Mercosur trade pact
items.summary: In a significant diplomatic effort, India and Brazil are engaging in negotiations to enhance their trade agreement, aimed at bolstering economic ties with the Mercosur bloc. Following Brazilian Vice President Geraldo Alckmin’s recent visit to India, the countries are eager to expand their trade preferences. The discussions are projected to wrap up in the next ten months.

items.title: RBL Bank likely to have a hybrid name post ownership change, open to inorganic opportunities
items.summary: The Emirates NBD investment is expected to open up new opportunities for growth for RBL Bank, including inorganic buyouts, and help bring down overall cost of funds, says MD &amp; CEO R. Subramaniakumar

items.title: Farmers eye better cotton prices despite import duty exemption
items.summary: Farmers in Telangana grew cotton in 18.61 lakh hectares as against the normal area of 20 lakh hectares.

items.title: Strict action initiated against those circulating fake videos against railways: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has launched a crackdown on those responsible for circulating deceptive videos about railway operations on social media. His comments came after an on-site evaluation of crowd arrangements at the bustling Anand Vihar railway station in Delhi. He urged travelers to exercise caution and not amplify erroneous content.

items.title: On Diwali eve, Haryana hikes sugarcane rates from Rs 400 to Rs 415 per quintal
items.summary: In a generous move ahead of the festive season, the Haryana government has announced a remarkable increase in sugarcane prices for local farmers, bringing the new rate to Rs 415 per quintal. Dubbed a 'Diwali bonus', this initiative is part of a broader strategy to ensure Haryana leads the nation in sugarcane pricing.

items.summary: Swan Defence and Heavy Industries is investing $500 million to transform Gujarat's Pipavav coast into a global shipbuilding hub, focusing on advanced vessels and strategic partnerships. This initiative aims to increase the country's shipbuilding capacity significantly.

items.title: Exports record positive growth in 24 nations in Apr-Sep; reflect market diversification
items.summary: Indian exports are diversifying. Shipments grew in 24 countries during April-September. This diversification offsets a decline in exports to the US. High tariffs imposed by the US impacted trade with America. Exporters are focusing on new markets in Africa, Latin America, and the Middle East. This trend is expected to continue.

This strategic move, coupled with JioMart's extensive physical store network, has fueled impressive growth in daily orders and customer acquisition, positioning it as a dominant player in the hyper-local delivery market.

This is not a comment on its current leadership, but prudence demands that it not only settles internal differences, but also chalks out a succession plan.

items.title: Mint Explainer: Do green crackers really cause less pollution?
items.summary: While green crackers are designed to emit up to 30% less particulate matter and fewer harmful gases, real-world effectiveness is limited by widespread use, counterfeit products, and enforcement challenges during Diwali.

items.title: India’s port-led vision is rewriting the geography of India's growth

items.title: Watch: Modi vs Trump: Politics and Economy amid tariff war | Talking Politics
items.summary: In this episode of Talking Politics, we speak to Dr. Jaijit Bhattacharya, Founder & President of the Centre for Digital Economy Policy Research, on Donald Trump’s proposed tariffs and their impact on India. The discussion explores whether these policies could push India towards the ‘Atmanirbhar’ route, the consequences for domestic industries and global supply chains, and how India can navigate this shifting trade landscape. Will Trump’s tariffs redefine India’s economic strategy?

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits

Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
